analysis_age: Explicit age bias in the phrase "open for young scientists"
text: :  . ,  . Huawei Moscow Research Center. Theory Research Group is open for young scientists (postdoc, Ph. D. graduation in 2019-2022) with backgrounds in Mathematics, Physics and Computer Science to join our team. Main research directions: Numerical and A. I modeling Methods, Deep Learning Theory, Mathematical Modeling in Physics, Communication Channel Research. We dedicated to the research and development of basic communications theories, supporting future product development with advanced theories, resolving pain points of academia's concern, searching for possible solutions, and exploring possible technological innovation fields. Our research is not limited to communications products, but may focus on a wide range of academic issues, such as artificial intelligence, computer technology, quantum information theory, and semiconductor technology. Responsibilities. Explore cutting-edge technologies. Independently undertake part of a research project. Output research reports, patents, and papers. Key Qualifications. PhD (Mathematics, Physics and Computer Science) with graduation in 2019, 2020, 2021 and 2022. At least one computer programming language, preferably Python, C/C. Interested in research projects, self-driven, innovative. Creative and able to collaborate with other team members. Good communication, writing and presentation skills in English. Experience in project development is preferred. What we offer. Work with cutting-edge technologies & challenging tasks in highly qualified international team. Opportunity to collaborate with world academic organizations, participate in top international conferences (we also conduct own meetups and conferences, and develop professional communities). Opportunity to contribute to real products used by millions of people. Competitive compensation  bonus. Medical insurance with dental coverage. Corporate discounts. Non-working activities (running club, chess tournaments and many more). Location. m. Smolenskaya, Moscow, Russia. Driving future technologies with focus on customer satisfaction is one of our missions. Welcome to join us! Huawei is a leading global information and communications technology (ICT) solutions provider. Driven by a commitment to sound operations, ongoing innovation, and open collaboration, we have established a competitive ICT portfolio of end-to-end solutions in telecom and enterprise networks, devices, and cloud technology and services. Our ICT solutions, products, and services are used in more than 170 countries and regions, serving over one-third of the world's population. With 180, 000 employees, Huawei is committed to enabling the future information society, and building a Better Connected World. At Huawei, innovation focuses on customer needs. We invest heavily in basic research, concentrating on technological breakthroughs that drive the world forward.
metadata:
{"document_id": "Kaggle::techmap::614cf5ee27d7dc4e9c667603::headhunter_ru", "source": "headhunter_ru", "country": "RU", "company": "HUAWEI", "position": "Research Scientist – Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science", "notes": "", "original": "

Требуемый опыт работы: не требуется

Полная занятость, полный день

Huawei Moscow Research Center

Theory Research Group is open for young scientists (postdoc, Ph.D. graduation in 2019-2022) with backgrounds in Mathematics, Physics and Computer Science to join our team.

Main research directions: Numerical and AI modeling Methods, Deep Learning Theory, Mathematical Modeling in Physics, Communication Channel Research.

We dedicated to the research and development of basic communications theories, supporting future product development with advanced theories, resolving pain points of academia's concern, searching for possible solutions, and exploring possible technological innovation fields.

Our research is not limited to communications products, but may focus on a wide range of academic issues, such as artificial intelligence, computer technology, quantum information theory, and semiconductor technology.



Responsibilities

  • Explore cutting-edge technologies
  • Independently undertake part of a research project
  • Output research reports, patents, and papers

Key Qualifications

  • PhD (Mathematics, Physics and Computer Science) with graduation in 2019, 2020, 2021 and 2022
  • At least one computer programming language, preferably Python, C/C++
  • Interested in research projects, self-driven, innovative
  • Creative and able to collaborate with other team members
  • Good communication, writing and presentation skills in English
  • Experience in project development is preferred

What we offer

  • Work with cutting-edge technologies & challenging tasks in highly qualified international team
  • Opportunity to collaborate with world academic organizations, participate in top international conferences (we also conduct own meetups and conferences, and develop professional communities)
  • Opportunity to contribute to real products used by millions of people
  • Competitive compensation + bonus
  • Medical insurance with dental coverage
  • Corporate discounts
  • Non-working activities (running club, chess tournaments and many more)

Location

m. Smolenskaya, Moscow, Russia

Driving future technologies with focus on customer satisfaction is one of our missions

Welcome to join us!

Huawei is a leading global information and communications technology (ICT) solutions provider. Driven by a commitment to sound operations, ongoing innovation, and open collaboration, we have established a competitive ICT portfolio of end-to-end solutions in telecom and enterprise networks, devices, and cloud technology and services. Our ICT solutions, products, and services are used in more than 170 countries and regions, serving over one-third of the world's population. With 180,000 employees, Huawei is committed to enabling the future information society, and building a Better Connected World. At Huawei, innovation focuses on customer needs. We invest heavily in basic research, concentrating on technological breakthroughs that drive the world forward. Our R&D Institutes do research in mathematics, algorithms, software tools, in fundamental theory of math, physics, chemistry, biology, geometry, logic, thermodynamics, bionics, etc.

Ключевые навыки

Английский — B2 — Средне-продвинутый
Research

Mathematics
Physics
Computer Science

Адрес

Показать на большой карте
